item.description:
Folks, the social series continues. Let's grab appetizers and check out the movie Young Victoria.

Appetizers at:

Agave Grill in Hartford at 6:00PM

Agave Grill
www.agavect.com
100 Allyn Street
Hartford, CT 06103-1418

The theater is a few minutes away. After appetizers we can head over. Bring a date, friend or come by yourself.

About the Film
(UK, 2009) Directed by Jean-Marc Vallée. Screenplay by Julian Fellowes. Director of photography: Hagen Bogdanski. Cast: Emily Blunt, Rupert Friend, Miranda Richardson, Jim Broadbent.

Whatever comes into your mind when you think of the Victorian Age, from workhouses to prudery to Empire, has little to do with the sheltered-but-feisty 18-year-old girl who became Queen of England, ready or not, in 1837. Emily Blunt (The Devil Wore Prada) is completely appealing as an isolated princess whose only companions in a cold and drafty palace are scheming politicians and a faithful spaniel, until the moment she meets Alfred, her scandalously handsome Saxon cousin. “A transcendent Emily Blunt stars in a rich pastiche of first love, teen empowerment, fabulous fashion and fate!” - Betsey Sharkey, L. A. Times

104 min.
item.name: March Social: Appetizers and Young Victoria
